content.text:
- **âš ï¸ High-frequency PR patrol cron enabled** â€” `PR Review Patrol (High Frequency)` every 10 min (job id: `8b380d56-7314-4ba9-b4c4-ea11d3e5ca6f`) to scan open PRs and spawn fix sub-agents when unresolved threads appear.
- **âš ï¸ Only review Bill's PRs (or my own)** â€” do NOT check, fix, or address PRs from anyone else unless Bill explicitly tells you to. This includes bot-authored PRs AND PRs from other contributors.
- **âš ï¸ bills-bot tasks: GitHub Issues is the source of truth** â€” not the Veritas Kanban board. Track work via issues, close them when done.
- **âš ï¸ PR comments rule** â€” sub-agents should NOT post GitHub PR summary comments unless Bill explicitly asks.
- **âš ï¸ PR review threads are PAGINATED (max 100/page)** â€” ALWAYS paginate when checking unresolved threads. GitHub GraphQL `reviewThreads(first:100)` returns max 100. If a PR has 100+ threads (PR #60 had 125), you WILL miss threads on page 2+. Use `pageInfo{hasNextPage endCursor}` and loop with `after:` cursor until `hasNextPage` is false. THIS IS NON-NEGOTIABLE â€” we missed 22 threads once because of this. Also applies to REST: use `gh api --paginate` for PR comments.
- **âš ï¸ Always check top-level/high-level PR review comments too** â€” not just inline threads. Review submissions (e.g., CHANGES_REQUESTED summary comments) can contain actionable feedback even when no unresolved thread remains.
- **âš ï¸ Merge conflict check** â€” sub-agents must check for and fix merge conflicts with the target branch at the end of every task.
- **âš ï¸ Never edit `openclaw.json` directly** â€” use `gateway config.patch` or `config.apply`
- **âš ï¸ `config.patch` array merge is SHALLOW** â€” include ALL fields when patching agent list items
- **âš ï¸ `main` agent must be explicit in `agents.list`** when any agents are listed
- **âš ï¸ Orchestration: Opus 4.6. Code writing: Codex CLI (gpt-5.3-codex)** â€” no Flash anywhere
- **âš ï¸ Bill needs to set `DATABASE_URL` in Railway** for bills-bot DB features
- **âš ï¸ Always use latest versions** â€” Next.js, Tailwind CSS, React, all dependencies. Bill's rule: latest stable versions of everything, no exceptions.
- **âš ï¸ Always use git worktrees for sub-agent work** â€” NEVER checkout branches in the main repo directory. Each sub-agent MUST create a worktree (`git worktree add /tmp/bills-bot-<branch> <branch>`) and work there. This keeps parallel work isolated. NON-NEGOTIABLE.
- **âš ï¸ Codex CLI for all sub-agent code work** â€” `codex exec '<task>'` on EVERY invocation (pty:true required). Default model is `gpt-5.3-codex`, approval mode `full-auto` (set in `~/.codex/config.toml`). Use `--yolo` for max speed in isolated worktrees. Sub-agents must NOT hand-write code with edit/write tools â€” use `codex` CLI for all programming.

## Infrastructure

See `TOOLS.md` for: MCP servers, endpoints, CLI tools, Tailscale IPs, codesession dashboard.

## Memory Rules
